title: Christmas.Sitcom.Classic.Episodes.My.Favorites.60s-70s
description:
Here are a few of my favorite Christmas themed sitcom episodes from the 60s and 70s. 

After the shows went to reruns, the holiday episodes would usually be removed from the cycle and only shown once a year at Christmas time. 

As a kid, I used to save Christmas episodes to video tape with a dual deck VCR. I dumped them all a few years ago. I should have held onto them, much easier to edit now. Oh well...



1. The Andy Griffith Show (S01E11) - Christmas Story (12/19/60) 

2. Bewitched (S01E15) - A Vision of Sugar Plumbs (12/24/64)

3. Happy Days (S02E11) - Guess Who's Coming to Christmas (12/17/74)

4. Married With Children (S02E13) - You Better Watch Out (12/20/87)

5. The Flintstones (S05E15) - Christmas Flintstone (12/25/64)

6. The Odd Couple (S01E12) - Scrooge Gets an Oscar (12/17/70) 

7. The Addams Family (S02E15) - Christmas with the Addams Family (12/24/65)

8. WKRP in Cincinnati (S03E7) - Bah, Humbug (12/20/80)



Funny, these shows follow one of three plotlines -

1. Alone at Christmas

2. Substitute for Santa

3. A Christmas Carol parody
	

I'm sure I would add more to this list when I find them. One that comes to mind is the Laverne & Shirley Christmas show at the Mental Hospital.


Please comment with your favorite  60s/70s era sitcom holiday episodes, either these or ones I may have missed.
